page.title: 08PATTERNS OF HEALTH
page.content: Lydbrook_Patterns of Health.During last century Lydbrook was a most unhealthy place to live.The brook running through the valley to the river was little better than an open sewer which spread disease and accounted for many deaths.Early this century people living in the houses near the bottom of the village were forced to remain indoors on hot days because of obnoxious smells. Tuberculosis caused many deaths.Miners suffered with silicosis,other chest troubles such as bronchitis and asthma were and still are common.Happily the brook now trickles harmlessly through the village to the river which proves a popular canoeing centre for visitors.The high level of humidity in the area could be the cause of the number of people requiring grommets in their ears.
